## Dropdown() function

Dropdown is the parent component for a set of Dropdown-related components.

It provides multiple shared contexts, which are consumed by its child components, and also registers some global event listeners.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export default function Dropdown(props: PropsWithChildren<{
    screenReaderText: string;
    screenReaderInstructions?: string;
    initialValue?: string;
    parentQuery?: string;
    onSelect?: (value: string, index: number, focusedItemData: Record<string, unknown> | undefined) => void;
    onToggle?: (isActive: boolean, value: string) => void;
    className?: string;
    activeClassName?: string;
}>): JSX.Element;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  props | PropsWithChildren&lt;{ screenReaderText: string; screenReaderInstructions?: string; initialValue?: string; parentQuery?: string; onSelect?: (value: string, index: number, focusedItemData: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt; \| undefined) =&gt; void; onToggle?: (isActive: boolean, value: string) =&gt; void; className?: string; activeClassName?: string; }&gt; |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

JSX.Element
